fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2025e1.equipments.heater

Interface HeaterExternalControlCI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.ComponentInterface, HeaterExternalControlI, HeaterTemperatureI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedCI, java.rmi.Remote, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    HeaterExternalControlJava4CI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    HeaterExternalControlConnector, HeaterExternalControlInboundPort, HeaterExternalControlJava4InboundPort, HeaterExternalControlOutboundPort

    public interface HeaterExternalControlCI
extends fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedCI, HeaterExternalControlI
    The component interface HeaterExternalControlCI declares the signatures of services used by the household energy manager to adjust the power consumption of the heater.

    Description

    Invariants

     invariant       getCurrentPowerLevel() <= getMaxPowerLevel()

    Created on : 2023-09-18

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

      • Fields inherited from interface fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2025e1.equipments.heater.HeaterTemperatureI

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SignalData<java.lang.Double> getCurrentPowerLevel()
      return the current power level of the heater in the power unit used by the heater.
      SignalData<java.lang.Double> getCurrentTemperature()
      return the current temperature measured by the thermostat.
      Measure<java.lang.Double> getMaxPowerLevel()
      return the maximum power of the heater in the power unit used by the heater.
      Measure<java.lang.Double> getTargetTemperature()
      get the current target temperature.
      void setCurrentPowerLevel(Measure<java.lang.Double> powerLevel)
      set the power level of the heater; if powerLevel.getData() > getMaxPowerLevel().getData() then set the power level to the maximum.

 post    return != null && return.getData() > 0.0 && return.getMeasurementUnit().equals(POWER_UNIT)

      • setCurrentPowerLevel

        void setCurrentPowerLevel(Measure<java.lang.Double> powerLevel)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: HeaterExternalControlI
        set the power level of the heater; if powerLevel.getData() > getMaxPowerLevel().getData() then set the power level to the maximum.

        Contract

         pre     on()
 pre     powerLevel != null && powerLevel.getData() >= 0.0 && powerLevel.getMeasurementUnit().equals(POWER_UNIT)
 post    powerLevel.getData() > getMaxPowerLevel().getData() || getCurrentPowerLevel().getData() == powerLevel.getData()
 post    powerLevel.getData() <= getMaxPowerLevel().getData() || getCurrentPowerLevel().getData() == Heater.MAX_POWER_LEVEL.getData()
        Specified by:
        setCurrentPowerLevel in interface HeaterExternalControlI
        Parameters:
        powerLevel - the powerLevel to be set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
        See Also:
        HeaterExternalControlI.setCurrentPowerLevel(fr.sorbonne_u.alasca.physical_data.Measure)

        Measure<java.lang.Double> getTargetTemperature()
                                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: HeaterTemperatureI
        get the current target temperature.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    return != null && Heater.TEMPERATURE_UNIT.equals(return.getMeasurementUnit())
 post    return.getData() >= Heater.MIN_TARGET_TEMPERATURE.getData() && return.getData() <= Heater.MAX_TARGET_TEMPERATURE.getData()
        Specified by:
